Funding title: Grant Program - Indigenous Women in Hard Hats
Purpose: Provide funding to fund Women in Hard hats. Through the Women in Hard Hats initiative, women are encouraged into non-traditional employment in Queensland’s ‘hart hat’ industries (mining and construction), as well as other traditionally male-dominated fields such as transport and logistics industries, science, engineering, technology and manufacturing.

Funding provided to Peak Bodies to act as a Housing Service peak advisory body. They are required to provide coordinated policy advice to the Minister for Housing and Public Works, on behalf of parties with an interest in Housing Services and how they impact on low and moderate income households. Funding title: Grant Program - National Rental Affordability Scheme
Purpose: National Rental Affordability Scheme is a national scheme supported by the Queensland Government to increase the supply of new affordable rental dwellings for low to medium income households.The scheme provides financial incentives for investors to purchase new affordable housing rented at a minimum of 20% below the market valuation.
Provides assistance to tenants in government-owned housing who cannot afford to buy the home they are renting. The Pathways Equity is a loan that enters into a partnership with the Government.

Assists suitable private market tenants to overcome short-term tenancy problems and strengthen their capacity to maintain a private rental tenancy. Financial Assistance may be offered over a two year period, where required to stabilise a tenancy, or to address other financial barriers to assist the client to remain in a private rental tenancy.
A Bond Loan is an interest free loan to help pay the rental bond or deposit when moving into private rental accommodation.
A Rental Grant is a once only grant of 2 weeks rent to help you pay for the cost of moving into private rental accommodation. A Rental Grant is for people in a housing crisis.
